G-computation maximum likelihood bootstrap

Source: R/gcomp_ml.R
gcomp_ml.boot.Rd

Using bootstrap resampling, calculates the log odds ratio.

Usage

gcomp_ml.boot(
  data,
  indices,
  R,
  formula = NULL,
  family,
  trt_var,
  ref_trt = "C",
  comp_trt = "A",
  rho = NA,
  N = 1000,
  ald
)

Arguments

data

Trial data

indices

Indices sampled from rows of data

formula

Linear regression formula object. Prognostic factors (PF) are main effects and effect modifiers (EM) are interactions with the treatment variable, i.e., y ~ X1 + trt + trt:X2. For covariates as both PF and EM use * syntax.

family

A 'family' object specifying the distribution and link function (e.g., 'binomial'). See stats::family() for more details.

rho

A named square matrix of covariate correlations; default NA.

N

Synthetic sample size for g-computation

ald

Aggregate-level data for covariates.

Value

Mean difference in expected log-odds

See also

strategy_gcomp_ml(), gcomp_ml_log_odds_ratio()

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
data <- data.frame(treatment = c(0, 1), outcome = c(1, 0))
gcomp_ml.boot(data, indices = 1:2, formula = outcome ~ treatment,
              R = 100, family = binomial(), N = 1000, ald = NULL)
} # }
